label.intro:
Impactful research takes into account the values and motivations of the potential end users.

Standard agricultural research is based on the interests of the researcher, which limits its potential impact as they may be different to the end users. Agroecological research instead takes a bottoms-up approach, combining farmer values and motivations with what research is possible. This helps ensure that the outcomes of a study are relevant, realistic and interesting to the potential users.
